message.content:
We have many transactions whose “type” is “Interest Receivables.” In an indirect–method cash‐flow, the “change in an asset” (here the balance of interest receivables) is computed by summing in the period all postings (which “increase” the asset if the asset rises and “decrease” it when negative postings occur). Because an increase in an asset represents a use of cash, the “(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable” is shown with a “–” sign.

Step‑by‑step we identify all rows with “Interest Receivables” and then add their “amount” values:

1. Interest20240101001:     1157.0 
2. Interest20240102002:     1023.5 
3. Interest20240103003:     890.0 
4. Interest20240104004:     756.5 
5. Interest20240105005:     756.5 
6. Interest20240106006:     756.5 
7. Interest20240107007:     647.92279104 
8. Interest20240108008:     647.92279104 
9. Interest20240109009:     558.92279104 
10. Interest20240110010:    558.92279104 
11. Interest20240111011:    424.61612886 
12. Interest20240112012:    424.61612886 
13. Interest20240113013:    424.61612886

25. Interest20240126026:    77.51612886 
26. Interest20240127027:    166.51612886 
27. Interest20240128028:    166.51612886 
28. Interest20240129029:    166.51612886 
29. Interest20240130030:    166.51612886 
30. Interest20240131031:    166.51612886 
31. Interest20240201032:    166.51612886 
32. Interest20240202033:    166.51612886 
33. Interest20240203034:    166.51612886 
34. Interest20240204035:    166.51612886 
35. Interest20240205036:    –11.48387114 

We then sum these amounts (we show the grouping roughly):

• Entries 1–6 sum to:   5340.00  
• Entries 7–10 sum to:   2413.69  
• Entries 11–16 (six postings at about 424.6161) sum to: 2547.70  
• Entries 17–18 sum to:   564.43  
• Entries 19–20 sum to:   333.03  
• Entries 21–26 (six postings at about 77.5161) sum to: 465.10  
• Entries 27–34 (eight postings at 166.5161 each) sum to: 1332.13  
• Entry 35 is –11.48

Adding all these groups step‐by‐step:
 5340.00 + 2413.69 = 7753.69  
 7753.69 + 2547.70 = 10301.39  
 10301.39 + 564.43 = 10865.82  
 10865.82 + 333.03 = 11198.85  
 11198.85 + 465.10 = 11663.95  
 11663.95 + 1332.13 = 12996.08  
 12996.08 – 11.48 = 12984.60 (approximately)

Thus, during the period the Interest Receivable balance increased by about 12,984.60. In indirect–method presentation a growth in an asset is shown as a negative adjustment (because it uses cash).

So the final cash flow statement item is:

  (Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable = –12,984.60

Presenting the answer as required:

    "(Increase) Decrease in Interest Receivable": "-12984.60"
  }
}
